text: Traffic bad, got home late, cooking dinner and realize man it's hot in here, called Stegall Joe Rider was our tech. He is my hero. I am now cooling off. He came in asked a few questions and said what he thought was wrong and he was correct. I highly recommend Stegall and ask for Joe.

name: Carey Crowder
text: Today Joe Rider came and worked on our air conditioner. He was very professional and had a wonderful personality. Mr Rider shook my hand and demonstrated great patience when explaining my new thermostat. It was a pleasure to do business with an individual like Joe. Thank you for hiring someone of this caliber and look forward to future business with Stegall.

text: John did a great job with my AC unit repair. He notified me of all my options and worked quickly to make sure the job was done right.

text: Our A/C went out last night and Joe was here first thing this morning and had it fixed before we could even blink. He identified the problem, replaced the motor and now we're in the cool again. I can't thank Joe enough for helping us out in such a timely fashion. Thank you Joe!!!

text: It’s late June. My house was 85°. A technician came and went and my issue was resolved within 25 minutes. He was polite, fast, and very knowledgeable. I also live in a condo so my access to the HVAC and condenser units was not the most convenient. Overall I am 200% pleased. Would definitely call Stegall again.

name: Shana Moton
text: Stegall offered excellent customer service from being on time for our initial quote, to offering the best quote we received, to being able to install our new A/C the very next day (on a Saturday!!).  Andrew with Stegall offered service with a smile, was very knowledgeable, and was very kind and upfront with us the whole time.  We were very impressed with Stegall and recommend them to anyone needing to replace your home's A/C - it's going to be a hot summer!! But, thankfully, we'll be sitting cool inside our home :)

text: I called Stegall for a broken AC. Joe from Stegall was at my house 2hours later and expertly analyzed my system. He gave his recommendation and I followed it. A crew from (Todd and Brandon) Stegall showed up the next day to install a blower to properly match my existing heat pump. Todd and Brandon worked in withering heat and paid attention to the smallest details, not scratching or denting my floors, or walls.  The heat pump developed another small issue and Joe came back to inspect the over all system AND fixed the heat pump issue not charging me the callout fee. Joe, Todd and Brandon are excellent at their jobs and are very personable people. Stegall is a quality company. I would recommend them to you.

text: We have used Stegall for years for yearly maintenance and other work. Technician Joe Rider has been wonderful, prompt and walks us through any issues!

I find Steagall and it’s employees to be knowledgeable and prompt and professional from the administrative side to the service side.

They explained exactly what part had gone bad, replaced it with a new one which they had on the van and had my air back on within the hour.  The charge for the work was more than fair and I will definitely use them again.

text: I knew that I needed a new heat pump as my current heat pump was 14 years old.  When I got home from church on Sunday and it was 80 degrees in my house, I knew I could put it off no longer. They came out to my house within a couple of hours of receiving my call, confirmed I needed a new system, gave me quotes and options, helped with me financing and installed my new system, all within 2 days.  They sold me a better system and a better price than what I had been quoted by another company.  Throughout the whole project, I was constantly being informed of what was going on and everyone was helpful, professional and nice. They answered all of my questions, no matter how inconsequential they may have been. Stegall is my company of choice and I will be happy to recommend them to all of my friends and family!

text: My house AC unit stopped working. I am a plumber by trade but I have no idea when it comes to hvac type stuff. I call stegall and they came to my house and investigated the problem. I assumed I would be looking at a huge bill because I have had similar issues at a different residence, and Norrell charged me $600, 3 separate times over a number of yrs. so I figured it was going to be the same ole same ole. But was wrong!!!! The technician that came out explained everything he was looking for and what I needed to look for and do to prolong my AC unit. Turns out I was not doing maintenance for the unit that I was not aware of. He fixed it quickly and in no time the unit was running properly. My wife was super excited and happy......happy wife =happy life. Lol 😂

name: Joe Allred
text:
My two HVAC units were due for annual spring service, and my commercial ice maker had stopped running .  Upon my request, Ken Speer called before his arrival, and promptly arrived on time. Very professional and friendly, Ken immediately began to perform the maintenance service due on my units.

I knew my upstairs heat pump system was in need of replacement, and Ken explained the problems with it, and recommended a replacement system that would be best suited for the space.

Ken determined the problem with my ice machine, installed the replacement part needed, and had my machine making ice, in less than an hour.

I mentioned to Ken, the water pressure in my house had never been sufficient, since I built my house in 2005, and he contacted a co-worker from Stegall's plumbing division, and upon his prompt arrival, they determined my pressure regulator needed replacing.  Stegall had the replacement part on their truck.  The new regulator was quickly installed, the pressure adjusted, and my water pressure problems were solved throughout my entire house, for the first time, since I built my house, 11 years ago.

I would highly recommend Stegall's services to anyone in need of HVAC, or plumbing service.  Ken Speer is a professional, knows his business, and promptly resolved 3 major issues within my home, and did so, in just a few hours.  I couldn't be happier with his customer service.  I give him an A+.

name: Crystal Adamson
text:
We had to have our 1970s home complete rewired because we had original Aluminum wire. C&T was one of the only companies that had certified electricians willing to take on such a huge job while providing a warranty for their work. We were very anxious about having so much drywall and sheet rock damage and the remodel snowballing.  We had weighed our options as far as doing copper extenders, adding arc breakers,etc. but decide to move  forward with the complete rewire for safety reasons . They prepared us for the worst but the damage was minimal; practically none. We are so exceptionally/ overly excited about the end product.
Their customer service was outstanding.  Bobby Walten, the owner,  worked with us and talked through the whole process as it was happening.
We will recommend C&T electric to everyone and will be using them for any of our future needs, should we have any.

text: If I could have reviewed at a zero star I would have. These people! They arrived late. We had called to have electrical wiring fixed from a fire under my uncle's house. They came out. They did absolutely nothing. Said they couldn't do anything until plumbing did their part which was fine. But why didn't they just charge me a service call? Instead they charged me a 150.00 for nothing. They were very sketchy. I wrote a check for the services. Them some women comes to the door asking me to re-wrote the check to a personal person because they couldn't cash it. Then when I asked for a receipt they said we don't have receipts today. Then when I thought ok something is not right here and called the office which was the dad he was in shock they asked for another check and had been told he didn't do anything....like I had not paid. Then he said let me see what is going on and I will call you back. He never calls back. The lady that I am pretty sure was on meth calls me back and says I won't charge when we come back. Well later that night my uncle has no hot water. They never turned the water heater back on. So that was a 125.00 extra charge from the plumber. It has been a total mess. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! RUN!

text: These are the worse electricians I have ever in countered.  They  started a job and did not finish. I had to call another electrician to redo all the work I thought MeLeod had completed.  I recommend you do not call these people not even to change a light bulb.

name: Craig Waldron
text: Don't use these people. I just left a job site where they left un-taped un-caped wires stuffed under the house. This is three feet from the house meter. Could not believe what I saw. How can these people be licensed. Need a 0 rating.

name: David Plokhooy
text: Under no circumstances should you consider using this company.  I contacted them to rewire a switch controlling one light and a ceiling fan (the light switch was working already but the ceiling fan was not).  They arrived two hours late, took out the old switch and could not figure out how to reinstall it.  In the process they disconnected several lines causing various lights, vents, fans, etc., throughout the home to quit working.  After three hours they quit, leaving hot electrical wires hanging out of the wall.  They returned the next day (three hours later than they agreed to arrive) and spent the entire day working on the wiring trying to determine why they had broken the circuit to the other locations.  After eight hours they "finished" and left -- with the switch they originally came to repair still not working.  After calling them the next day they sent another person who worked on the wiring and finally got the original switch working and the other outlets they had disconnected working but still did not ever get the ceiling fan working.  They then presented a bill for $85 for the original service call and $375 for the repair work they had to do to solve the other problems they created, and, the ceiling fan switch still does not work. $460 total for them to actually do nothing.  The switch that was working is still working, the circuits that were working before they disconnected them are still working as they were before McLeod arrived, and the ceiling fan still does not work.  I now have to hire someone else to perform the one task they were supposed to do.  Clueless, unprofessional, undependable and absolutely a waste of time and money.  Run away from these guys.

name: Michael Shannon
text: AWESOME!! I called on Thursday to get a quote to have a new new outlet in my attic on a dedicated 20 AMP circuit installed. The super nice woman on the phone got all my info and scheduled a technician to come to my house the next day (Friday) at 2:30 to give me a quote and schedule the install for a week or two later. Greg showed up on time (actually a few minutes early) introduced himself and we chatted about what I wanted installed. Greg answered all my questions, checked my attic, and my house electric panel to ensure all was good to complete the install. Much to my surprise, Greg said he could do the install right then, no need to schedule another appointment!  Greg had everything installed, checked, cleaned, and up and running in under two hours! Very professional company, exceptional customer service!  Thank you Greg!!!!

text:
They were called out for an emergency job that took less than 3 hours and a single pipe. The pvc pipe they glued in is still working and they assure me they'll repair it if it fails but I doubt they could have messed up gluing a pvc pipe. However I didn't expect them to be incapable of providing an itemized receipt so they definitely surprised me.

Worth considering alternative providers.

name: Steve Kendrick
text: After some major hurricane damage, I had several large companies put me on a wait-list for months.  Then when they were able to inspect the damage, they said they couldn't help me because the damage was too big.  I called Restoration Services, not only did they order my supplies and had the delivered the next week but their team did all of the work in one day.  They even helped me deal with my insurance company on getting the most current prices for materials.  I would recommend their services and will be using them in the future.

resp.text: That's fantastic to hear! We are so glad we could be of service and we appreciate and value our customers. Let us know if you need anything in the future!

name: Norman Davis
text:
Restoration Services, formerly Davis Roofing, has earned my trust and continued business. Last year when a Hurricane blew through town, I had suffered roof damage along with many of my neighbors. Being fortunate and not actually displaced from my residence, I opted to wait a few months to solicit repair estimates while those who needed immediate help were being serviced.

When the rush had died down (or so I thought), I reached out to multiple companies for estimates. I quickly realized that getting someone out to even give me an estimate was going to be a challenge. Numerous companies offered to come out but none actually followed through. Until I found Davis Roofing! They arrived within a few days at the precise time I was promised. A detailed professional estimate was provided to me and my insurance company for a complete roof replacement.

Upon acceptance by my insurer, they asked me for my business.  At this point, they were the only company to respond. I took a chance with a single estimate, mostly because of promptness, professionalism and effective communication. I was not disappointed!

Driving through my subdivision, I have the best roof in the neighborhood! The price I was quoted was the price that I paid. An addendum was even sent to my insurance company (by them) for additional expenses to be paid to me. That was a pleasant surprise.

The efforts and communication of this group did not end when the job was over. I have been contacted multiple times over the last year with inquiries on my satisfaction. What more could I want? With this latest communication, I made mention of a single shingle that had slipped and looked crooked on the eve above my front door. The customer service representative promised to have the repair crew out to fix it. It happened the next day!

Folks, I don't do many Google reviews. It takes a lot to impress me! Suffice to say, Restoration Services has done so and has earned my business going forward. I like the fact that they have expanded their offerings to include electrical services as well. I know they will be there, if needed. They will be my only call! Thank you again for an excellent experience!

Norm Davis

I took the time to share this with everyone in our company. It was such a boost for us all! I just can not thank you enough!

name: Fran
text:
This review is ONLY about the AC side of Blevins A/C . I have used both the A/C and Electric services from blevins. I want to say the Electrical side is top notch. I would give them a 5star rating.

Now on the to A/C service. I ordered a whole house dehumidifier for my 2100SQft. home. I was told by aprilaire and another AC company that the aprilaire 1830 was the size I needed for my home. So I purchased the unit. Anthony  came out to install the unit.
After the install the unit wasn't working as it should. The humidity wasn't coming down in the house. So I tried to work with Anthony to resolve the problem. He did call support for aprilaire. And after going talking with them they decided that the unit was undersized. The unit is a 70pint and should cover a 2800sqft. house. I wanted my humidity around 45 to 48 %.
this unit was only getting it  to 57%. that is what I started with , so it wasn't working at all.

After talking with support myself. I was told that the unit needed to be installed per the recommended installation. Which is from return to return. It needs to work with the AC unit to achieve peak performance.

Anthony installed it from return to supply. which I was told by aprilaire that causes a resistance from the supply air and the air coming from the dehumidifier. He did not install a drip pan under the dehumidifier.( he took the charge off for the drip pan) He used 12" duct which isn't recommended. And added reducer down to the 10" inlet

So I asked Anthony to install it per manufacture .  He straight out refused. I have a copy of the text and a lot of pictures to post. Also have an email from tech support stating the correct way to install is per the manual install glide.

I added the correct duct work and put a drain pan under the dehumidifier and rerouted the drain line.
The Dehumidifier is work as should now humidity is around 47%.
The only thing I asked Anthony to do is install it the preferred method ( which is what he should have done in the beginning and we would not of had any problems)  and he refused. I plan on sending a complaint to the Association.

I will not use the A/C service again. And wish I could use the electric service because they are awesome. They fixed several issues I had. Plus was able to fix a problem that 2 other companies was not able to fix. But it is a family owned business.

resp.text:
Since you chose not to share what happened only to leave a bad rating let us help you with that. Fran decided she wanted to save some money and buy a dehumidifier herself instead of purchasing one through an authorized dealer. She asked us to install it which we did by the manufacturer requirements. Her humidity is already down to 50-55% in the home but she insist that it must go lower. We tried to help her resolve this issue for a week. After contacting the manufacturer and going over our installation in detail to make sure it was no error on our part it was determined that Fran had purchased the wrong size unit to fit her home. The following is from Aprilaire contractor tech support.

Unit is undersized for the space and you would be lucky to reach 50% with an 1830. If you want to go to 40%, you would need at least an 1870. That being said, staying in the 50-55% range is perfectly reasonable place to be, and is safe.

Thank you,
Jacob

Jacob | Technical Support Team
Aprilaire, Division of Research Products Corporation
1015 East Washington Avenue | Madison, Wisconsin  53703
Phone: 1-800-334-6011 | Fax: 608-257-4357 | www.aprilaire.com
Technical Support Hours – M-F, 7:00 am to 5:00 pm CT

Thank you for your business but the only problem is you were given incorrect information then expected our business to stand behind a product we did not purchase.

name: Tracye Spencer
text:
I will never use this service again!!! I don't know if what happened to me, happened to anyone else but, on Friday, May03rd, I turned my A C on for the first time because I knew the colder weather had passed on by.once I turn my air on, I keep it on72degrees no matter what cause I also have ceiling fans and floor fans which helps to keep my power bill down. Well, the A C didn't come on so I called American Home Warranty which provided me with my info and called Same Day maintenance (cause I've used them before to install a thermostat in my home), the technician came out flipped the switch on and never went outback to check my unit...naturally I was happy because now I'm knowing I have air. Kept my doors and windows opened and up until around7:30 because it was really hot inside and I didn't want the unit to work as hard cooling the house inside. 3:00 before day Saturday morning; I was drenched in sweat.not understanding what's happened, got up, checked the A C inside..on. Went out back, checked the unit..no fan turning, unit very hot..turned off A C inside, called SameDay around 8:00 that morning, left emergency message..no return called. Called again all day every30 minutes- an hour...no phone call. Same repeat for Sunday. Monday morning I was on the phone calling them from7:30 until the answering machine picked up and I asked them to please call me back..didn't call me, I called back again finally getting someone who told me they would check with the tec. to see when he can come b out( mind you, this is a re-call) so I should have been a priority along with other people who had an emergency over the week-end not wait until Wednesday to try and work me in. I was told Wednesday morning that the Tec. would be out between 1and 5pm. Okay... I'm trying to hold my self in check because now I'm feeling disrespected and ignored. 4:35 no Tech..I called their office back after the 2nd phone call I was told this guy name Andy would give me a call...what???
It's already4:55 I said" call me" he should be here by now i2don't need him to call me.. She said" that's what he told me to tell you" . long story....so he called5:10 said he would look at his schedule and see if he could get to me tomorrow( Thursday)....I'm sooo pissed now, hot and disgusted...called American Residential warranty back, explained this same thing to them and told them I will not use Same Day Maintenance anymore and to place that notation on the computer by my name...so now I'm searching the internet trying to find someone else who will come out asap to get me up and running......I recommend no body uses this service...at all. I know for some people it works find for you, but there are those of us who feel it's a race thing( that's my own observation people) if it works for you...more power to ya!!!👺👺👺👹👎👎👎

text:
We have been looking for someone to repair or install our kitchen phone line. We called several electrician and phone companies to fix it. We were told by the phone companies they don't do repairs on inside lines anymore and that electricians now have to do that. So I stopped in at Univeristy Electric on Monday and talked to them about this. They were so nice and said they would be glad to come out and fix it. That they would put us on the wait list and call when they had an opening. Tuesday morning at 8:15am I got a call from them that they could come out this morning if it was ok with us. Wow, that was fast. So Thomas came out to see what needed to be done to fix the issue, got the right stuff, spent a couple of hours running a new line and fixed our issue. Thomas was very nice, friendly and professional. He checked several other things dealing with the phone connection. He made sure we were happy with everything and also made us aware of other services that available through his company. So have no doubts we will definitely use them again!! So thanks a lot University Electrical for your help.
Rick & Lisa Breeden

text:
After hiring Brinkley to install a ice make I can tell you i was very disappointed, First of all they were suppose to show up at 3 to 3:30 i was called and told it would be later as they were running late; ok. Then when they got there i was told i would have to pay over time charges even though they were late not me to do the job that day, very upsetting. In discussions with the plumber, I was told after completing the work they would charge me for 2 hrs work when i got the bill the charge was for 3 hrs at an over time rate. I called for an explanation the lady on the phone told me the extra hr was for time it took for them to run down parts; and that they always charge for that i told her the plumber told me differently that i was not responsible to pay for time it takes to get parts, i then received a phone call from the plumber he said the charge was for travel time, I don't know which one to believe all I know is the plumber said they don't charge for the time it takes to run down parts, so it seemed pretty misleading that i was charged for what now appears to be travel time; humm! what should I believe.
I am old fashion, tell me something and I will believe it and follow what you said, I feel like i have been mislead in order to meet the statement on the bill; I should not have been charged over time when your company was late, and i believe this sudden change of what i am charged for is just another misleading statement. I have sent you a check but i will not use this company again!

name: J K
text:
I needed to get my air conditioning system repaired.  So I called several HVAC companies, and I quickly found out that the repair cost was high enough that I was better off getting a new air conditioning system. So I did some research, and then I got quotes from 11 different companies. Of the price range of quotes, Xcalibur was among the lowest. So I chose Xcalibur, and the next morning, Ryan, Mark, Jacob and Zachary showed up and installed a new air conditioning system and furnace (I actually didn't need a new furnace, but the extra cost to add a new furnace to the a/c installation job was low.).  The installation guys were professional (for example, they put on shoe covers before entering my house) and knowledgeable.

I'm glad that I chose this company. First, Ben and Ryan are actually honest people. Also, Ben and his employees seem to take pride in doing a good job.  My new a/c system not only comes with the standard 10 year warranty for parts, but also a 10 year warranty for LABOR.  Call other HVAC companies yourself and ask if they include a 10 year labor warranty on a/c installations.  When they say no, ask them what the labor cost is to replace a compressor or an evaporator coil.  Also, Xcalibur installed new line sets with my a/c system. But some HVAC companies cut corners by not installing new line sets.

Since Alabama Power is my electricity company, I can track my electricity usage via Alabama Power's website or their app. My new Bryant a/c system uses about 39% less kilowatts than the American Standard system that it replaced.  In just the first month of using this Bryant a/c system, I saved over $100 on my Alabama Power bill!  I also found out that Bryant equipment and Carrier equipment come out of the same factories because they are sister companies.

If I could give Xcalibur 6 stars, I would. But Google only allows me to give 5 stars.

name: Tim Walker
text:
I always research before I make a big purchase.
My neighbor used Excalibur after getting 5 other quotes so I gave the owner a call. The whole team was friendly and professional. Other companies told me it would be weeks before they could get to me. I had a quote within hours of calling them and a full install in a few days. I really feel good about the work that was done, the product (Bryant) and the price I was quoted. Will definitely use them for future hvac service.

name: Carla Jean Whitley
text:
I initially scheduled a dryer duct cleaning with another company. When the tech didn't show and the company couldn't tell me what happened, I hopped on Nextdoor for recommendations. Ben Kayatta and his team came highly recommended, so I submitted an appointment request through the website. This was on a Friday afternoon. By Saturday morning, I had an email from Ben that said he emailed, rather than called, to avoid disrupting my Saturday morning, but that he was available to schedule my service when I was ready. He made my appointment for Tuesday morning, only two business days later.

As promised, the technician, Zack, called before he headed my way. He arrived at the promised time and was just as efficient throughout the appointment. Zack showed me where my dryer duct ran to and explained what he was going to do. The vent hose on my machine was much longer than necessary, so he offered to trim it to reduce the possibility of it getting bunched up and causing additional issues. Zack was finished within an hour of his arrival and happy to answer my questions.

Xcalibur is fairly priced and competent. I will call Ben and his crew again.

text: I was very surprised and thrilled with the work Kayatta Heating and Air did for me. I was in dire straits to get work done before closing on the house we were selling, and had 2 business days to get it done. I explained this to the rep I spoke with at Kenyatta, and they were able to work us in. In addition this,  the technician was very professional, did the work in a timely manner, and explained upfront what cost there would be. Ive never been happier with any HVAC service I've had done, and will use them again if I have any HVAC needs.

name: Bryant Miles
text: Ben is on time and very professional. He knows his industry very well and explains what needs to be done in simple terms I could understand.

name: Brad Goddard
text:
Had someone come out to give me an estimate on a commercial job 2 weeks ago. Never heard from them again.
Edit:  While working for my neighbor they used my parking lot as a turn around for their trucks.  One truck smacked the side of a camper causing considerable damage and lost me a customer.  They also cut down a neighbor's tree and left it on MY property.  If I could rate negatives I would.

name: Bradley Funderburk
text: Incredible work for a very reasonable price. We had them install a large ceiling fan on a 25ft ceiling, install an electrical outlet over the fireplace, and 2 other light fixtures and an outdoor outlet and they did it all in under 5 hours. Scott was awesome!

name: Matt S
text: Not once, but twice, they have charged us UNDER THE QUOTED PRICE!!!! Who does that? Not bigger companies with overhead for bloated marketing campaigns. Huffman does skilled work (warned drywall might be damaged during an install, but it was left pristine), under-promises and over-delivers in terms of time and cost. Oh, and they’re on time without needing to trumpet it to the world.

name: Ralph Calvert
text: Great people which makes for a great company from the lady that answered the phone to the gentleman that came out and did the work thank you.

name: Aminah Masood
text: This is the best electrical company I have ever worked with. Extremely friendly service, and they sure do go above an beyond their duties to make you happy. I had my front porch light removed, door bell button replaced, and my flickering bathroom light fixed. He even went to the light company and picked my fixtures for me

name: Heatherly Satterthwaite
text: Super friendly staff! Always on time!! Great work!!!

name: Mary Angrisano Ladner
text:
It's no wonder that they currently scored a 4.6 in customer reviews! Mr. Jones aka the owner arrived at my home this morning.!!

Evidently there was some confusion with the original employee who had been scheduled to come and a little after 8 my stepdad spoke with the receptionist and boom 10 mins later. The actual owner of the company arrives!!

So here's the breakdown people in  what I and hopefully most of society look for when searching for help in a serious trade work
.. 1) They keep their WORD 2) Its about an HONEST days work no big words and we have all seen it and probably experienced it where you are talked down to and told things need to  be  done that sound very complicated when in fact their not
Leads me to 3) TRUSTWORTHY  which you may think is the same as honesty,.
.. but NO alot of individuals will be very blunt and narcissistic but that is how they truly are. So TRUST HONEST WORK WITH HUFFMAN ELECTRIC BECAUSE THEY KEEP THEIR WORD. As the kiddies say they dont "talk it" they "walk it" ! Very very grateful and they are going on my list of reputable companies that I can count on one hand. I am a loyal customer and now this Friday morning ,which started off badly has gotten alot brighter!!

name: V Johnson
text: Super friendly! Good work

name: Addy Plays
text: This is a great service because it’s my best friend family business!

name: Tim Heath
text: Awesome company! They have done multiple jobs for me over the years and have always done a fantastic job. Their crews are respectful and professional. I will never hesitate to use them in the future!

name: Willard Moore
text: Initially forgot about our appointment, but came over within 30 minutes after I reminded them of the appointment.  Received the quote four days later for the new electrical service and panel, but very hard to get on the phone.  Their prices are fair for a quality electrical company.  They were highly recommended by La Bits AC/Heat.

resp.text: We would like to apologize for not getting back to you in a timely manner.  The quote has already been sent to you prior to this incident.  It seems we were blessed with a tremendous amount of unexpected business and were very understaffed to handle this sudden influx of fortune!  Thus it caused a blip in our normal quick customer oriented service.  Please feel free to contact us directly if you have any further questions or concerns.

name: Russell
text: Called them to ask for a residential quote. Was told they are too backed up to give a quote and sent me to another contractor.  I'm giving you five stars because I get things happen but sending me somewhere else is not a good business practice. Bizarre.

resp.text: Thanks Russell!

name: Harold Justice
text: We needed three receptacles installed and a ballast replaced in the garage at about 16 feet up. Got an estimate from a National chain service and they tried to upsell us with things we did not want or need. Their estimate was much too high for what we needed. My builder, Byrne Turner, recommended Bippen. A tech named James and his apprentice Austin worked efficiently and got everything done in about the time I expected which was much less than the time estimated by the other company. Based on this experience I highly recommend Bippen.

name: Natalie Hasley
text: I had a wonderful experience with Bippen Electric.  The technician showed up on time, understood what work I needed done and got it done in the time frame we discussed.  He was polite and very accommodating to all of my questions.  The work done was very professional and high quality.  I would highly recommend.

name: Randy Gallien
text: High quality & reliable work.  Exceeds all expectations & employs a staff of highly trained employees who all put the customers’ needs first.  I have never been disappointed and have always been completely satisfied from their General Generator installation & service to whole house surge protection to my most recent Tesla charger installation.  Not only quality work but quality work consistently over several years.

name: Candace Newby
text: Bippen Electric is very professional and dependable. They get the job done in a timely manner while ensuring the customer is fully satisfied. I would recommend their services to everyone I know.

text: This is one of the best businesses to ever work with! The technician Aaron was professional and easy-going to have work on your home. There were electrical issues that happened at my house and Bippen Electric was first and foremost in excellent at explaining the issues and handed me an estimate for the issues via email. This company comes highly recommended. I will continue to use this company for my electrical needs for my home. Afterall your home is your investment.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and for your business! We appreciate it very much!

name: Joann Loy
text:
I can very highly recommend this company! They are promp, courteous, and friendly! They are very reasonable-even offered me a discount-I didn’t qualify for military discount but I did the senior discount. The work was done quickly and neatly! Everything was explained and I can truly say I trust them—not very common these days. I had gotten a quote for the same work from another company and they were going to be close to 500 more and tried to scare me into thinking if I got for less I need to beware—I did not appreciate that and looked further and found Bippen. I am glad I did! They are now going to be my “go to”
Electrician! Call them! You will be glad you did!

name: Tawana Jones
text: Aaron was phenomenal! He was both friendly and professional making it easy to work with him. He also educated me a bit on what was causing the issue as well as ways to prevent future trouble. He would definitely be my first choice for any and all future electrical needs. Thank you Bippen ans Aaron for finding and fixing the issue that others claimed didn't exist.

resp.text: Wow! That’s great to here! Thank you for allowing us to serve your electrical needs!

name: Kenneth Graves
text: I read a number of reviews before hiring Bippen, and have to say I couldn't agree more with all of the excellent reviews.    Not only was the work and finished product outstanding, the personnel were knowledgeable, helpful, polite, and informative.    Arrived on time, finished ahead of time, plus I get points with the wife because they cleaned up and left things way better than they found them.

name: Dwayne Miller
text: I have used Bippen two times in recent months.  The technician I have had both times was Aaron.  Aaron is top of the line when it comes to knowing electricity, but even more important is his personality skills.  It's not the name on the truck that makes a business good or bad. In this case, it's the person driving that truck that makes Bippen Electric a #1 company.  Thanks for a job well done.

name: Russ Meyerriecks
text:
Had a small wiring job. They took extra time to walk me through all the options. Very friendly people. I would definitely hire them again.

*edit* After 2 excellent jobs, Bippen cancelled a critical panel-might-catch-fire type of job the day before and advised that I call Mr. Electric. Mr Electric fixed it for me same day with much less hassle. So I suggest you take Bippen's advice as well and save yourself some trouble.

text: These guys do excellent quality work very efficiently and at a very reasonable price. Will definitely use them again for any future needs and can't recommend them enough. You will be happy you called them!!

She even threatened to cancel the installation of my backsplash that was scheduled for the next day.  Needless to say........I did go in and pay for the sink.  Very unprofessional.............considering I have been a loyal customer for years.

text: Sam was very knowledgeable and courteous.  He took the time to answer a litany of technical questions and explained every detail of what he was doing.  Excellent service!  Thank you!!

name: Bradley Wilkes
text: Super appreciative of the work the team did installing a cassette mini split in our home.  All my dealings with the Capital have been professional and pleasant and I will definitely recommend them to family and friends in the future!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review Bradley!

name: Jessica Stephens
text:
Giving 3 stars only because it is the average between the two components of service received.

Technicians/Product Installation - Five Stars! Over-the-top knowledgeable, courteous and timely!

Communication/Interaction with Jacob Oswalt - ZERO stars. Very snarky, condescending and entitled when he could have just been transparent. Followed through with the install only because our AC was already completely out.

New units work great and we are so happy it is done, but I definitely would not recommend this company.  Too many other reputable companies that are not such a pain to deal with.

resp.text:
Jessica,

I am glad you are happy with the installation. I am sorry the rest of your experience was not satisfactory. We did our best to work with you on an expedited schedule given your existing system was not operational. We were able to move you up from the original scheduled date to get your systems installed sooner. Most of our communication was after hours and over email, so I'm sorry if it came off as snarky or condescending as that was not my intention. Sometimes things get lost in translation over electronic versus verbal communication. I am glad the installation went well and that we were able to get your new systems installed in a timely manner. I apologize again for any misunderstanding or miscommunication and hope you will consider us in the future for your HVAC needs. Please let us know if you need anything else. - Jacob Oswalt

name: Mike vonEschenbach
text: Great response time when our generator was down, Eric was very professional and diagnosed and fixed our generator fast to get us power!

resp.text: Thank you for the review!

name: JeffScott Ktoe
text: Technician arrived on time. Courteous and polite. Used shoe booties when entering my house. Completed work in a timely manner. Payment either a credit card or check. And friendly to my dog.

resp.text: Hi JeffScott, we love to hear about your pleasant experience with us! We appreciate your kind feedback!

text: The service technician was polite, careful, and thorough. He relentlessly tracked down the issue and fixed it. He explained every step he was taking so that we had no surprises. We couldn’t have asked for anything better.

So professional, and attend to every detail in the service experience. Highly pleased!!

Keeping our systems running at peak performance has always been their goal.

resp.text: Hi Bob, thank you for such a thoughtfully written review! We are so happy to hear about your pleasant experiences using Capital and for being a great customer these last 20 years.

name: Beth Palmer
text: Got home from a long trip to find heating system not blowing through any of the air ducts. House temperature was freezing cold! Called Capital Heating early the next morning after Googling a few local companies....received super professional customer service from Laura (sp?) and Cindy who arranged the appointment for same day service. 😳😳🙌🏽🙌🏽 Not only did the technician, Bobby S. show up as expected, he was SUPER professional, courteous, and thorough in his diagnosis of the problem. Bobby explained the problem with the system in plain terms, left/returned to pick up the needed part and made the entire process feel extremely transparent and straight forward. Will definitely be calling on this company in the future. Great job, Bobby!!! (The house is warm and toasty because of you)! Great company. Star employees.....👌🏽🙌🏽✅✅✅😁

resp.text: Hi Beth, thank you for the wonderful feedback! We are so pleased to  hear about your pleasant experience with us and we will be sure to pass this along to the team!

name: Alice Wideman
text: Our tech was Matthew Harper and he was great! He was prompt, knowledgeable and got the problem fixed quickly. I would absolutely recommend Capital Heating and Cooling!

resp.text: Hi Alice, we are so pleased to hear about this! We will make sure to pass along the kind words to Matthew.

name: Tony Nichols
text:
I recently used Capital Heating and Cooling to install a 22kw Generac generator at my home.  I was extremely pleased with the service I received.  Tommy Oswalt came out and did an initial site assessment and gave me a very realistic look at all the work necessary and the expense involved.

Once the generator arrived, technicians Ben House, Eric Gray and Colby Winham came out to pour a pad on the slope beside my house.   Because of the steep slope, they had to build a form to pour a slab for the generator to sit on.  Our generator was installed the next week and being in the service industry myself, I was very interested in each stage of the process.  The guys all did a fantastic job of making the installation look neat.  When Hoover inspectors came out to give their final inspection, it was apparent that they had worked with Capital Heating & Cooling often enough that they knew everything would be up to code and signed off on the job without a comment.

All the guys were very professional and did exceptional work.  The office staff also went out of their way to help make sure Spire followed through and installed a larger gas meter  (Thanks Laura)

I could not give Capital Heating & Cooling a better review. Job well done!😃

resp.text: Tony, thank you so much for the positive feedback. We appreciate your patience while we worked with Generac, Hoover Inspections, and Spire to get everything set up. We will pass your review on to our technicians as well! Please don't hesitate to give us a call if you need anything else.

name: Africa Green
text: Excellent Service all the time. The techs are professional and friendly. I appreciate the care that the office staff takes with scheduling and being proactive in sharing the details of who we should expect for upcoming service appointments.

resp.text: Hi Africa, thank you for the kind review. Your feedback means so much to us!

name: Mark Williams
text: Capital Heating & Cooling replaced the A/C portion (indoor evaporator coils and outdoor condenser coils) of two Trane HVAC systems at my home, one for the main level and one for upstairs. I am very happy with their work. They took the step of identifying that the original pvc piping used for the drain for the unit in the attic was not draining effectively (a worker in the attic poured a gallon of water into it while another worker in the garage observed and noted the water did not make it to the drain in the garage) and they corrected that, mounting fasteners in multiple places along the PVC pipe to ensure it sloped properly in its run across the attic, and they replaced the rusted overflow tray beneath the HVAC unit. They also eliminated the traps in the drains for both units, which is where algae would always build up; the traps were apparently redundant because both drains feed into a drain in the garage floor that has a trap beneath the concrete floor. They left straight cleanouts in place of the p-traps which should reduce algae buildup, and I can still pour vinegar or chlorine to reduce algae. The three workers, Bobby, Jason, and Matt seemed trustworthy and very competent. The installation looks really well-done.

FYI..Not honest about their rates when you ask several times.

resp.text:
Ms Williams,
We are so sorry to hear about this and we want to know more about your experience to try and rectify any issues you may have had with our service call. We want complete customer satisfaction and we hope we can speak to discuss your issue and how we can help you. We are here to help, please give Aubrey (our owner) a call and he will be happy to speak with you. We have also reached out to you via text message. Thank you!

I really appreciate their responsiveness, quality of work and exceptional service! Thank you!

name: Neil Keith
text:
We needed some work done quickly. I reached out to Aubrey on a Saturday. He worked with me over the weekend to get an estimate as well as giving me a couple days early in the following week the work could  be done. He was professional and. very helpful making me understand the work that needed to be done. Even though i called him several times, he always got back to me promptly  and professionally.

On the day the work was scheduled to be done, Jeremy and Jacob were on site early and started the job promptly. They were very courteous, professional, and prepared. They had everything they needed to finish the job and would not stop until all of the work was finished.

They cleaned everything up and provided additional contact information in case we  needed to talk to them. I have recommended them to several neighbors and certainly will use them if I need work done again.

Their pricing was great.

resp.text: Thank you Neil for the kind words! We are happy we were able to help you and make it a super experience. Thanks again!

name: Cameron Faili
text: I'm so grateful we called John's Electric and had Aubrey as our technician today! We are new to the area and needed a professional electrician to help us troubleshoot a recurring issue in the basement (which houses our water heater). We called this morning and their office staff was very helpful and allowed us to speak directly with Aubrey about the issues. He confirmed a same day appointment and was incredibly knowledgeable, honest, and helpful. Aubrey checked the specific room and closet we needed and was thorough enough to check the entire basement to ensure no other issues needed attention. His assessment was clear and honest and his recommendations included a simple, inexpensive solution. He did not try to up sale services that weren't required, and thanks to him, we now know that our electrical setup in the basement is functional and safe. We didn't spend money that we didn't need to spend. We will definitely call John's Electric, and ask for Aubrey, the next time we have a need for an honest electrician. We highly recommend them!

name: Debbie Greengard
text: Was awakened at 4:30AM by loud beeping noises coming from, what we thought, was our hardwired smoke alarm system. Made numerous calls to other area electricians that either couldn't come out immediately or had "dispatch fees" of $180 or higher. Saw the reviews for John's Electric and am so called we made the call. Jeremy and Jacob were at our home within 30 minutes. They were professional, courteous and friendly. They got right to work trying to solve the problem and quickly found that, not only was our carbon monoxide detector the issue, but our smoke detectors were way past their expiration date. Upon our request, they were back out first thing the next morning--right on time--replacing everything. So glad we made the call. They didn't try to upsell anything--even when we asked them to take a look at a few other electrical issues. Their prices were excellent for the replacements and installation and they didn't even charge us for the original emergency call. We experienced just how hard it can be to find good, honest businesses that can be trusted and that won't take advantage of anyone during emergency situations. We highly, highly recommend them and will be referring John's Electric Service to all our friends!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and your business!

text:
I cannot say enough great things about this company. My husband and I are doing some upgrading in our home. This required replacing almost all of our light fixtures, some being relocated. It was a two step process. The electricians took everything down, my contractor patched the ceiling, and then the electricians returned to install the new fixtures. Terry and Colin were my technicians. They were on time, efficient, and very communicative. When installing and relocating the fixtures, they were meticulous in their measurements to ensure the fixtures were in the proper place. They spent a great deal of time here making sure everything was perfect. When I got the bill, I was actually shocked it was not more. However, with zero knowledge of this industry, I had set myself up for it to  cost a fortune. Very affordable, thorough, knowledgeable, and professional. Highly recommend. After everything is painted, they will be returning to replace all of the switches as well. A++++ service, and it takes a lot to impress me.

Update: The replaced all of the plugs and switches, and even added in some new configurations for me. I bought all the wrong metal, and they were able to supply the correct metal so that everything would be up to code. I had the same two gentleman, and they were excellent. Highly recommend!

name: Rosalind Ware
text: Vince with Crosby Electric did a wonderful job! The service was very professional and affordable!

name: Chris Betzler
text: Had a great experience with Crosby Electric. I scheduled a service call for the following morning and was told to expect a call at 7 and someone onsite by 7:30. The following morning, I received a call at 7 and someone was onsite at 7:30. The two technicians, Mike and Colin, were friendly (much friendlier than I am at 7:30 in the morning), knowledgeable, and thorough. With such a high level of service provided, I was expecting to pay more for it, but the final bill was actually less than what I expected. Would highly recommend them for any electrical work you need.

name: James Woodfin
text: Outstanding service! I had a small window of opportunity for the repairs and Crosby Electric made it happen. Best of all, when I heard the price for there work I was very pleased. Great people,  great service, and at a great price . Crosby Electric is going to be the first and only company I will call for electrical work around any of my properties .

name: Braden Pace
text: They came in, gave me a reasonable estimate, and did the work all in the same day. They even came in under the estimate by the time they finished. Very professional, easy to work with. I wouldn't hesitate to use them again. I highly recommend them for your electrical needs!

name: Kenny Chen
text: Terry was very professional and very thorough with the CurrentSafe assessment of my house after a lightning strike.

name: Jim Dunham
text: I had bought a new Home Theater System and was told by some “Geeks” that my rear speakers could not be mounted on the walls. I called Crosby and they sent Michael and Colin out. Not only did they agree to do it instantly, they did it with a smile and a great attitude. While they were here, I thought of a few more jobs for them that weren’t considered normal electrician work but they gladly helped me out. And in the process, they earned a customer for life. If you’re needing electrical work done by a friendly, knowledgeable team, call Crosby right now!

name: Joe Clark
text: We’ve used Crosby for several small electrical issues around the house, from installing outdoor floodlights to hanging a ceiling fan. They always do a great job. They’re the only place I’ll call for electrical needs.

text: We had a great experience with Crosby. Very reasonable cost for the work. Punctual, courteous, and got the job done quickly. We will be calling Crosby next time we need help with an electrical issue.

text: Travis and his assistant arrived in a timely manner and after a brief review of the 6 outlets to be updated, they began efficiently to work. They cleaned up after themselves and left me a very satisfied customer, when I was presented by a reasonable bill for the job. I plan to have more work done in the near future and will ask for Travis as he was quite competent in dealing with my circa 1939 home's wiring.

name: R Martin Ladner
text: Found and provided what I needed and did it nicely and quickly at a good price. I'm a repeat customer. :)

name: William Johnson
text: I just want to thank Travis Wilson for a job well done. My door bell was not working I had another electrician to come out all he did was take the wires lose from door bell and hook them back up. Said he would get back with me. It never happen, Mr. Travis took all door wire a lose, wires from my two door bells and trace the problem down. He did not give up until the problem was resolved. Thanks Crosby Electric!

name: Tom Fitzpatrick
text: Mike Ousley did a fantastic job at my house today.  Of course, Crosby Electric never sends anybody except the most talented electricians.   They are an honest company, who never attempts an up-sell (as I've previously experienced with other reputable company's in the Montgomery area).  Crosby Electric provides a first rate service, with talented electricians, and they get it done right the first time, every time.  Today, Mike and his apprentice, Collin, replaced my entire electrical service to my house.  It needed doing. We'd replaced breakers here and there, but it was time to replace the entire box.  The work performed was very neat and orderly, and what's best....it worked the first time, plus the cost was very reasonable.  What more can you ask for?  I will always trust Crosby Electric.  Thank you!

name: Terry Ballant
text: Matt from Crosby arrived on time and quickly went to work locating a faulty wire in our attic that caused problems along an entire wall of the house. We had an electrician from a different company (NOT Crosby) last week who was  unable to find the problem.   Matt was methodical in his approach and soon located and repaired the problem. We are very happy with Matt and our interactions with the office staff of Crosby. Definitely rate all aspects at 5/5!

name: Hallie Stiglitz
text: I requested electrical services for two issues I was having at the house and emphasized this to the tech multiple times while he was on-site. He completed the installation of the requested dedicated circuit for the dishwasher but the attention to detail was poor. As he was leaving I had to point out that the direction of the junction box had to be changed to safely plug in the dishwasher which he did after I brought it to his attention.  I asked him to address the 2nd issue but he felt that it was no longer a problem since he pulled the dedicated circuit. I asked him to check before he left. He did not and within 5 minutes of leaving I was again experiencing the problem. When I called to address the issue I was told someone could return the next day and for >$700 grounding rods could be placed prior to diagnosing the problem. This is highway robbery and unnecessary. In my frustration I was able to spend hours working on the wiring myself to correct the problem. I called and asked that a manager call me back to discuss the entire situation and I have since heard nothing from them (it's been several days). If you need someone to come out quickly for service, they can certainly help with that but in my experience they are not thorough and their pricing is atrocious. They will spend most of your time trying to up-sell you to a package you don't need rather than just billing you for the actual work completed. Incredibly disappointed with this experience.

resp.text: We regret to hear you did not have a 5-star experience; this is not the type of service we strive to provide for our customers. If you have not already spoken to our management team, please reach out to us at (205) 224-9038.

name: Cornesha Terry
text: I received a quote to have a chandelier changed out in a two-story living room with very easy access to the ceiling. The technician quote was for $1,600. I thought that I just didn't know how expensive it would be to change it, so I almost accepted the quote. But, I was urged to get a second opinion. I easily found another highly recommended certified electrician to do the the job for less than $200. I am very disturbed by the pricing structure that this company uses. The quote was ambiguous, unspecific, and extremely overpriced. Also, I had to pay $29 for an on-site quote. Many electricians provide estimates over the phone. Make sure you get a second opinion before you go this route. You could be grossly overpaying.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your thoughts and feedback with us. We are disappointed to hear about your poor experience with our company. If you have not already spoken to our management team, please reach out to us at (205) 224-9038.

name: Kathy Chahrouri
text:
First, Brad SHOWED UP! ON TIME! We have been 2 months making appointments to do this (even with some Thumbtack guys) only to be stood up repeatedly.

We started out wanting low voltage wiring run for a hard-wired video doorbell. But it ended up being way too involved and expensive in our 120 year old house. When putting back our porch light, he wired up the dusk to dawn sensor which a previous worker had left undone.  Mind you, he took nearly two hours poking around in our walls just trying to figure out how to get the low voltage line run and give us an estimate to do that, which I'm sure was reasonable for the complexity of the job, but was way more than we could spend on this project.

We also had a wireless video  doorbell on hand, so Brad switched gears, gave us a very reasonable estimate to install it, installed our wireless doorbell, walked us through the app set-up, and made sure everything worked before he left. He was very punctual, precise, and super friendly to boot. Wish I could give him 25 stars!

name: Bham
text:
We recently hired Mister Sparky and was not pleased with the service and technician.  The technician originally quoted us an extremely high rate.

We told the technician that we are going to get more quotes and appreciated coming out and providing an estimate. The technician became very pushy and would not leave until we agreed on lesser amount verbally.  (1st Red Flag)

The technician than began to start working while blaring music really loud, which was heard down the street for hours.

The technician told us that he likes listening to music while he works and did not care if we had a problem with it while laughing.  Within 15 minutes from the start, he barged into our house and said he could not perform the services that we all agreed upon for that rate.

He insisted that we pay additional funds to complete services.  We told him that we were not paying a penny more and that we were becoming irritated with him and the company. (2nd Red Flag)

We then told the technician that he could leave and we would have someone else come out and do the job for less.  The technician then became irate and started making verbal threats while laughing. (3rd Red Flag)

Furthermore, we observed the technician through video surveillance trying to hide on the property while smoking cigarettes and throwing the butts on the ground.

The technician spent more time telling us how great his work would turn out versus just completing a job and leaving.  We clocked 4 1/2 hours for approximately 45 minutes of work.

We tried numerous times to run the technician off the property, but he kept wanting to talk.  He apparently wanted to hear himself speak.

We would never hire these guys to do any work and advise others to stay away from them. They overcharge their customers and are completely rude and unprofessional.  Apparently, we found out later that they hire individuals with criminal history.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Customer's satisfaction is our number one goal and we would like to ensure this situation has been investigated immediately. We have a very strict hiring process, including background and drug tested employees. We would like to view the video surveillance as we have a no smoking or cursing on customer's property policy. If you haven't already spoken to our management team, please reach out to us at 941-524-1291. Thank you.

name: Geary Chlebus
text:
I contacted several electrical companies to correct problems in my home. Mister Sparky stood out from the other competitors based on our telephone conversation and the answers to my questions about the issues I was experiencing.  I was offered a free inspection to determine what exactly the problems were. They offered to provide a copy of their business license and proof of insurance – this was assurance I wanted.
The following day, Brandon (electrician) and Jamarcus (assistant) came to my house (Pelham, AL) and conducted a free evaluation of my electrical system, which took several hours to complete.  I admired them going under the house in 105 Degree heat.
Brandon and Jamarcus identified the problems with the electrical system. Brandon clearly defined what work was needed and what the results would correct. Several issues were deemed severe and needed immediate attention.  Other items could have waited. His proficient knowledge and experience detected Brandon's 17 years of being a certified electrician.  Brandon explained my problems in very easy to understand language and showed me where the problems existed. Brandon and Jamarcus's demeanor, attentiveness, and attention to detail were impressive.
Brandon ensured me that all work was guaranteed.  I was to contact  Mister Sparky and ask for Brandon if any problems arose after the job was completed.  My wife and I chose Mister Sparky of Birmingham  based on the free written quotation for the work, total breakdown of cost, and the financial options payment plans offered to make the repairs affordable,
I selected Mr. Sparky first and foremost on Brandon's interaction with my wife and me. Brandon came across as a caring professional. Jamarcus was also instrumental in being detailed and focused on getting the job done correctly.
I wrote this lengthy response to assist readers in learning what kind of positive experience I had based on the examples provided.
GC

text: We have been living in our house for almost 2 weeks and wanted to get an outlet installed so we can mount our tv above the fireplace. Matt and his assistant were absolutely awesome. They showed up on time, assessed the situation, found out one of our breakers was messed up, and gave a quote to us. While this wasn't an easy job (putting the outlet in did take quite some time as they had to pull power from an upstairs outlet) they did it with a smile and were very pleasant. I would HIGHLY recommend Mister Sparky and their crew for any electrical needs. We just moved here (GO VOLS!) and finding great people that do great work is always a relief and a blessing.

name: K C
text:
Job: Estimate for recessed lighting

Appointment # 1: At the time of scheduled arrival, I was informed that the technicians were dealing with other emergencies, and that my appointment would need to be rescheduled. I re-scheduled for 4 days later.

Appointment #2: Appointment confirmation email stated that arrival window was between 12pm and 3pm. At 2:50pm, I got a call that stated that my technician probably would not be able to arrive until after 6pm. Unfortunately, that wouldn’t work since I had to be at work at 5pm.

Updated review below and stars updated as well:

3rd time, manager comes out to do the estimate. On time. So good. Schedule appointment for a few days later to do work. Also get an inconvenience discount.

4th appointment (work day): appointment is for 9AM in the morning. Was called at 9AM stating, again, like the first missed appointment, that they were dealing with “emergencies” so they would be unable to get to me until that afternoon.

Call Mr Sparky corporate and speak to more upper management. Get an additional $200 something dollars off the job and they show up at about 430pm with 4 guys.

In about 5 hours, they set and wired 4 recessed lights, hung several light fixtures replaced an outlet, and replaced 3 breakers.

I’ll say this about Mr Sparky, the electricians they have seem to be highly competent at what they do. It looks like they do quality work.

However, they are very focused on “selling” jobs and that’s where they make their money. So you have to be careful about getting talked into things you may not really need ie: whole house surge protection, etc...it’s also what gets them behind. They will show up at one job, and get up sells, so a 30 minute call can turn into a 2 hour call due to the upsells.

Summary: seems to be quality electricians that do quality work, however, they did not show up at 2 of my appointments and were 7 hours late to a third, so staffing and corporate policies and focus look to be issues.

text: This post if for the work performed by Travis.  He was on time, very professional and cared about his quality of his work.  I would highly recommend him for your electrical needs.  He ran power to my electric gate.  When complete, the area looked clean and neat as it did prior to the installation.  Thanks for a job well done.

name: Elle Johnson
text: I would give this company a negative star! As a subcontractor for our builder, A-1 Electric failed to complete items found during our final walk through inspection and close of our home on 29 January 2021. The following electrical items were found incomplete at our final walkthrough and documented on the 30 OT for follow-up for A-1 Electric to come back and complete these items within 30 days, 2 Mar 2021: 2BR vanity light and 2 ring door bells that were never wired; and 3 dimmer switches which were not installed for our kitchen canned lights per contract. Since moving into our home, we have discovered the patio fan was not wired, a socket was not installed in the 2BR, there are visible sparks from the hall closet switch when we turn it off and on, the GFI for the laundry room which has a sink was placed on the opposite side of the garage, and our canned lights in the master bedroom flicker when we turn the fan off and on (watch 10 sec video where canned lights flicker when using the fan switch). Now, since moving into our home we have had light fixtures replaced by another electrician for areas not related to the aforementioned. The construction manager on site relayed this back to A-1 Electric that he witnessed another electrician in our home and made assumptions and even went so far as to running the hired electrician down in his vehicle to see what this hired electrician had done in our home. Because of this, A-1 Electric voided our 1 year warranty without completing the work they left undone in the first place. At no time were we told, verbally or in writing, by the prime, subcontractor or the construction manager that we had to wait until A-1 Electric completed their unfinished work they hadn't done, and items the construction manager failed to catch prior to us closing on the home-- that we couldn't have light fixtures changed out. Furthermore, after we went to the prime we were told they were not able to get anything in writing from A-1 Electric concerning voiding our warranty for this cause either. If they were to produce a document now, it would be to cover themselves because of this review. A-1 Electric should be held accountable and reprimanded for trying to negate their responsibility to finish a job that was identified up front for them to complete instead of making up a loop hole based on the construction manager's assumptions. If the construction manager was doing his job he wouldn't be flagging down another electrician to inquire about the failed work he, as, the construction manager and having oversight of A-1 electric didn't do! If he put that same energy in doing his job then he would be more confident in the end product and not run people down in the street. The hired electrician could have been my brother or family friend who happened to work for an electrical company. I would not recommend this company and as a 20 year War Veteran have a mind to initiate everyone that I know across this nation to post this exact review on my behalf...

name: Gayle Maner
text: We used A1 to install electrical work on our back porch. They wired outdoor fan, LED lights, flood lights and fixtures on front porch and in laundry room. Very professional, on time, and clean job...they left the area very neat and clean. I am so grateful for the quick response and amazing job. Highly recommend this company

text: A-1 - 13 months ago, bought Stoneridge home, A-1 banged 1K chandelier against ladder during installation, lost remote controls for fans, put in wrong size light switch plates,  drilled post for sconce removing nearly entire supporting post - light eventually fell off wall, and now they come back to straighten light post-break screw off and tried to wrench and  drill it out, then scratch my expensive post light - denying it of course.  Then reinstall the post with two screws so its more lopsided than when they began. Never use these incompetent folks.

text: A-1 completely wired our new home! They were very professional! What a great job! I would definitely recommend this company!

name: Ellen Simard
text: A1 Electric was the subcontractor that worked with my home builder. I have had reoccurring problems with the fence column lights shorting out, several outdoor outlets not hooked up, and several outdoor outlets going bad. I had several warranty repair visits to correct the problems over the past year; but, still have outdoor outlets having issues. This will be the 3rd or 4th time one of the outlets have malfunctioned. I called today to request yet another repair visit and was told that they won't warranty their repair from the last time. The manager/owner was extremely rude, loud, and condescending. I literally asked her to slow down so I could could try to understand what she was saying. She argued that she already repeated herself a couple of times and that I was asking the same question. This manager/owner needs to take a phone etiquette class and learn how to talk to customers. She was out of line with me and has lost a good customer. I will never call this company for any electrical issues again.

text: I too have recently bought a stoneridge home... Let's just say that experience has been far less than perfect.... Anyway, I had a few issues come up 3 weeks in and called the A1ELECTRIC.( Actually my agent contacted them for me) they were out in less than a week and within 20 mins had fixed all the issues as well as had great info on some other small things that could go wrong if not corrected because of some of the things I had plugged in my garage. Long story short the guy that came out from A 1 was fast very friendly and more than knowledgeable and helpful. Every experience is different but for me it was great... I wish that the rest of the build went as smooth as it did with this guy.

name: Brenda Maris
text:
I bought a stoneridge home that is less than 13 mos old since purchase.  A-1 is the electrical contractor for the new construction.  My kids are grown and I work long hours so the home has little usage/traffic.  I don't even cook!  Just recently, the pantry light stopped working.  I called A-1 Electric and was told that it was out of warranty.  True by about a few weeks.  I was also quickly told by the VP that the problem could not have been caused by A-1 since it had been working for a year and it had to have been caused by another contractor.  Seems like a convenient response to avoid taking responsibility.  No one has touched the electrical system since I moved in and now my pantry lighting does not work.  I would have thought A-1 would stand by their work.   Of course, they offered to come out in 3 weeks at a service charge of $125.

Very disappointing...To regain service,  the wire will have to be replaced.
With no easy access to the attic, sheetrock will need to be cut, repaired, and painted with an estimate of over $1000.  Completely unacceptable workmanship.  Buyers pay close attention to your electrical contractors.

They also redesigned the the whole line from the main cutoff  to the sprinkler cutoff making it up to code and functionally perfect. You can barely tell they were there so clean up was excellent too. I will use them in the future.

He worked about 15 minutes AND WAITED for 30 minutes for glue to set.Pretty good money for a sprinkler repairman. I don't know if doctors make that much?

name: Terry Sorrells
text:
We found ourselves in a difficult situation with a drain and when we called the office, they were so helpful in letting me know that they would get someone to take care of the problem right a way. The technicians were very professional,courteous and knowledgeable in knowing how to fix our problem.
Their rates was very reasonable.  I will look no further when I have any type of plumbing problem than this company. They are truly a first class company.

name: Drew Hubbard
text: They responded quickly on a Saturday. The technician was very professional and worked quickly. They charged an hourly rate and billed one of the hours partially, which I did not expect. Highly recommend!!!

name: William Fleming
text: The gentleman was courteous and professional. He repaired a leak that would have been torture for me to do myself and on a non PVC/non PEX pipe. The fee was affordable and reasonable. I recommend them. They are in my phones contact list now.

name: Daniel Messenger
text: We had a drain that was clogged on one end of the house (the kitchen end) which wasn't affecting the bathrooms. When I called, I was told that he could come after hours at a higher rate or he could come at 2 the next day. I was fine with 2 the next day, but much to my surprise, he was there at around 9:30 that morning! I wasn't home at the time, but my wife sent me a message that he was there, so I went home. He was pretty much done by the time I got there, but I did some tests to make sure everything was draining properly as he packed up his tools. He emailed me an invoice on the spot, and he was off to the next job! I will definitely use them again if I have plumbing issues!

resp.text: We appreciate your business! Thank you for going with Fast Az Services!

name: darrel couch
text: This business installed a 30 amp plug for us for our camper and they did a great job and the technician was very polite and efficient.

resp.text: Kris, thank you for choosing Fast Az Services LLC!

text: Kenny the plumber really gave us confidence that he could fulfill our needs, gave us a great bidding, and even said he’d have the job done in a few days. White

I called Fast As Services, I was greeted warmly by a receptionist. They had a very friendly young man come out in two hours and fix my pipe. It was affordable, and I would highly recommend.

Update April 11, 2020.
Used their service again. Still same day service. Well priced, and I don't think I've met any nicer staff. If something breaks give these guys a call.

text: My husband and I had a major electrical problem and we called Mr Electric and our technician's name was Will and he is THE BEST!!  He is a man of his word and he is so knowlegeable and honest and he is so polite and nice.  We will never use anyone else. text: Installed a 240 volt circuit in my garage and installed some ceiling fans. They came prepared and were efficient and courteous.  Rates were fair. I would definitely hire them again.

name: Jill Boatwright
text: Mr. Electric of Etowah and DeKalb Counties has wonderful service.  Will Martin (Mr. Electric) is such a pleasure to meet and very dependable in his service.  Other electricians that I have dealt with have sometimes been late or never shown up or even returned my calls.  Mr. Electric has always been on time and the service is incredible.  I was having a problem with a can light and ceiling fan.  Mr. Electric came right out and discovered the problem right away.  He also did a wonderful job installing a ceiling fan in a bedroom.  He later put a new fan in my kitchen and it looks wonderful.  The best thing about Mr. Electric is that they are local and very trustworthy and dependable.  Also, the skill and knowledge of Mr. Electric is excellent.  His prices are reasonable and he knows his stuff!  I highly recommend Mr. Electric for ANY electrical need you may have.  These days it is hard to find a good electrician who will serve household electrical needs.  You can't go wrong with Mr. Electric!!!  Awesome +++++++  Hokes Bluff area.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  We appreciate your business, and hope you will call us back for your future electrical needs!

name: Kristi Little
text: Very professionl and trustworthy!!! Great, quality work. I highly recommend Mr. Electric of Dekalb/Etowah county.

name: baby dew
text: I called Franklin Electric because they were referred to my mom by her home warranty company. When the expert arrives at her home she was told they do not work with home warranty companies. He was nice but she said he smelled of alcohol. He replaced a receptacle when her problem is much bigger than that. She didn't want me to say much but she doesn't want anyone else to call expecting them to work with home warranty companies when in fact they do not.

name: Dan Lane
text: I needed someone to make an urgent repair to the lines to my house after Hurricane Eta. Karl answered the phone and said he would be there in 3-4 hours after finishing a couple of other jobs. He arrived in 3-4 hours and finished the work the same day. He then called the power company to report the repair so power could be fully restored.
