text: I TRIED CALLING SEVERAL TIMES AND EVEN LEFT MESSAGES,  BUT NEVER GOT A CALL BAXK FROM ANYONE! RESPONSE TIME IS NOT PROFESSIONAL. "COMMUNICATION RUNS A OCCUPATION!

text: Do not use them if you want things done! Had them come out to do home warranty work. They showed up, told us what was wrong, said they would be back with a part and never came back. Could not even get them to call us back.

name: Steve Casey
text: I have used Bham Fast Repair on several occasions now. They always respond quickly, show up on time, and do good work for a fair price. I’ll continue to use them and highly recommend them.

name: Beverly McCutcheon
text:
TRAVIS, I got the best finally. Gave up, looked for Gutter Repair. 8 years of misery with Gutter Company that installed never could fix. Same areas. Travis has been here several times repairs and so much more. More then I can say this man has done.Truly needed him years ago. Stopped all the problems I have had for 8 years with leaking gutters, A nightmare for me. I feel rescued. Has been so great I could never say enough about him. A really nice man too I got know well as I was out there with him showing me what was wrong and needed. So where would I be now without Travis. Another person or new gutters? First day he came I was horrified what he found. Asked him do I just need new gutters again, was worried then about the whole house. He said no, he was repairing them, I needed to see what was wrong, those areas. Travis saved me a lot money and stress I have been through with the thought of new gutters and couldn’t be repaired. I will always use him.
I see now here too maybe he can clean them. Had no
Idea all the other things this company can do. Will be helpful for me too. All the great reviews and I have just gotten one of them, Travis. Must be just like him.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review! We are very pleased that you were happy with Travis and will pass that along to him!!

name: Devon Rankin
text: Hired BFP to install screens for my existing back porch. Blake contacted me the day after I submitted my request to talk through it. We communicated via text and phone after as questions came up and then Blake put together a detailed scope for the work and made great suggestions for materials to use for the job. We ran into problems sourcing the materials (very high demand!), but he kept me informed of the delay along the way and was able to begin work as soon as we had what we needed. Work was performed over a 3 day period, and Blake showed up on time and worked diligently each day. He kept me updated on his progress during the day and the end product turned out great. We can't wait to start using our newly screened porch.

resp.text: Thank you so much Devon!  We are so pleased that everything went well and will happily share your kind works with Blake!

name: Lawrence Sheffield
text: BFR is the best in the business! I wish I called them sooner. Thanks Seth and Gibbs.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the review!! We are so glad you were pleased!

name: Charles Simpson
text: Can't say enough good things about this service! They showed up, on time, the day after initial call. Tim assembled our patio furniture in just over two hours. We are so pleased. We'll never use anyone else. Thanks, guys!

resp.text: We are so glad you were pleased!! Thank you so much for taking time to do the review !

name: Bryan Ramsey
text: About a month ago I had posted a negative review about Birmingham Fast Repair, and I'm here to say that I was WRONG!!! They were quick to respond in the most professional manner to my complaint. Seth made this matter his top concern, which every customer would want. This just goes to show the quality of customer service this group has. Seth was very apologetic (which he did not need to be) and did a fantastic job on installing my french patio doors. Seth was such a pleasure to be around. Not only was he professional, but he took time to get to know me and my family, which went beyond my expectations. His work and craftsmanship were very impressive. He definitely knows his work and set the bar very high. I could write this review all day on how pleased we were to have him in our home and his work product. I feel like I have finally found a company that I can trust to do an Honest, and PROFESSIONAL job at an unbeatable price. Seth's work has transformed our home beyond what we thought it could look like. I would highly recommend SETH and Birmingham Fast Repair for all of your projects. They will definitely be my "go-to" company for future projects.

resp.text: Thank you so much Bryan!  We really value our customers and appreciate that you took time to write this review for us.  We are so pleased that you were happy with the work Seth did for you and very grateful that you gave us a second chance! Please call us again any time!

name: Madison Williamson
text: We have used this company twice now- for building our deck, building our fence, and staining our deck! Great value, great quality, and very friendly staff!

resp.text: Thank you so much Madison! We appreciate that you took the time to leave us this nice review. We look forward to working with you again :)

name: Michael Forester
text: Gibbs, from bham fast repair, repaired a fence that was damaged from Zeta. I couldn’t get any companies to call back because everyone was busy because of the storm. I ended up getting in contact with bham fast repair. They put me in touch with their employee Gibbs and I dealt with him for the rest of the project. Very efficient way to handle work especially since I couldn’t even get a return call from others. We worked out the details and it was repaired within a  week or so. He saved us money on supplies and followed through on everything he said he would do. He was even early to my house to start the repairs. No surprise charges either. Very impressive individual and company. If I ever need any other odd jobs done, I’ll definitely reach out to Gibbs and Birmingham Fast Repair

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review Michael!  We are so glad that you were pleased with the way your job was handled and with Gibbs!  Please call us again for any future needs!

name: Hadden Smith IV
text: Great company. Quality of work was exceptional and the worker we had was very professional. I'd recommend them to anyone.

name: Sheena W
text: It was a pleasure working with Chris. I live out of state and own a 4 plex. One of the units were vacant and needed some paint/drywall work before being put back on the market. Chris was quick in contacting me, quick to start and complete the job and great at maintaining constant communication throughout the project. He was very willing to go above and beyond in assisting me. He provided before and after pictures and a walk through video explaining everything so I could be comfortable with his work. I can't physically be there, so he was my eyes and brought unknown issues to my attention, which he verified with pictures. I have a property management company, but their bids were high to do some of this work, which is why I shopped around and found Birmingham Fast Repair.  They also didn't catch some of the issues Chris did. My experience leads me to believe that Chris is nothing short of honest, knowledgeable, trustworthy, and hardworking. Highly recommended.

resp.text: We appreciate your business. Thank you for the generous review!

name: Karen Register
text: Mailbox uprighted & concreted into position. Gibbs did a great job! On time, professional, skilled for job, communicated well, detailed. Thank you!

name: Joe Walker
text: I can't say enough good things about this experience. From my initial phone call with Shannon to the finish of the job, it has been such a pleasant experience. Travis is the best! He was in constant contact with me. He was able to come do my job a week earlier than scheduled, and was able to come earlier than the appointment time. Imagine that!!! And to boot, he charged $100.00 less than the quote. He was that fast! The work looks great. I told him that I will definitely use them again in the future.

resp.text: Very kind. Thank you!

name: Bradford Acton
text: Everyone should be using this business. It's not just about the cost, or the quality, or the professionalism. More than anything else, when you use BFR you know you are going to get a quality worker, an honest person, and a company that cares about those things as it grows.

text: I had a gutter that drained poorly on top of our exit stairs. Travis came on time, very polite, did a fast accurate professional job and charged half the quote. WOW that was great. He was a really nice guy, friendly and conversant, and answered any questions I had with expertise.  I will definitely use this company again, as well as recommend them to my friends!

name: Yuhua Zhang
text: We had our porch stairs down and I submitted a request online. Blake quickly responded and scheduled time. he came exactly on the time he promised and estimated the work. He handled the job very professionally and efficiently. After the job was done, he cleaned the work place and hauled away the old stairs. We are very happy to the job he accomplished. We highly recommend Blake to who needs home repairs. He is great! We thank him again for making our home much better.

name: Joy Phillips
text: We had a list of mostly small repairs to get done before listing our townhouse for sale.  Birmingham Fast Repair and Kyle Butler are such a blessing!  BFR website made it easy to get started.  Kyle made it easy to get the work finished.  We had a kitchen drawer that wouldn't close properly.  Small problem but essential to get it fixed.  Contractors weren't interested in such a small project, several "handy" guys looked at it and couldn't fix it.  Kyle fixed it within the first 20 minutes of walking through the front door!  From there he went to the squeak in the kitchen floor.  Fixed!  We needed new lattice panels on an outside storage closet.  Done!  Life is so much easier because of  Kyle and Birmingham Fast Repair.

resp.text: Thank you for kind words! We truly appreciate the feedback!

name: David Dolinger
text:
Chris Evans was my repairman and did an excellent job.  The work was paint and repair on our chimney cap so involved climbing up on the roof, screening, caulking, and rust-proof painting.  Chris arrived on time, was very nice, and worked safely and efficiently to get the job done in a timely manner.
We are very happy with his work and will call again when needed.

resp.text: Thank you David. We truly appreciate the business. And the feedback!!

name: Jeff Iftekaruddin
text: The Absolute BEST!  What a pleasure to find this terrific company in Birmingham.  Each step of my customer journey was EFFORTLESS.  Seth, Shannon and Chris made my life so much easier. I will be definitely be using them in the future! Thank you Seth, Shannon and Chris!

resp.text: Thank you Jeff for the kind words! A pleasure working with you as well!

name: Kaitlin Brown
text: This is a hidden gem of a home repair service. The variety of work they're able to do is so wonderful! I really appreciate their timeliness and professionalism with each repair.

name: Aaron Gray
text: Luis did a great job on the handyman tasks we've given him. He started on a fence repair and has done a number of other things around the house from painting to plumbing. Seth Corbin is also a good guy. Highly recommended.

name: R Thompson
text: Tim did great work cleaning and repairing our gutters, and came out within an hour of our initial phone call. Great communication and will be happy to hire again.

resp.text: Thank you! Will pass on to Tim!

name: John Willard
text: Birmingham fast repair was so great to work with. Seth and his crew efficiently fixed the problems that we faced. Can’t wait to use BHM fast repair again.

resp.text: Thanks John! Always a pleasure to work with you.

name: Bryan Ramsey
text: It took about a month for someone to come out to do measurements (started the 2nd week of March). I was told I would be contacted 2 weeks later for an install. I understand this happened at the beginning of the COVID-19 situation and is a hard time for all of us, but I had not received any other communication or follow up from anyone. I had sent text messages on 2 occassions (a month after measurments) and no response. I'm not sure what its like in this line of work, but I was willing to spend close to $3K on the project and not a peep from anyone. This may not seem like a lot of money in this line of work, but $3K for a day or two of work I would be running to complete this job. I'm  concerned about the lack of follow-thru in communication. There are plenty of people that need work and it's disappointing to see the lack of interest.

resp.text: Bryan, I appreciate the feedback. Obviously we missed the mark on this one and I sincerely apologize. I’ll certainly look into what went wrong and make the necessary adjustments to prevent this from happening again!

name: Grace Willis
text:
Couldn't recommend anyone better! (Ask for Ethan!)

I called Birmingham Fast Repair to book a quote and possible appointment to install a pedicure chair's foot rest at my job. They were very fast and informative to book someone for us. They sent an email with a name/photo/bio/contact of who the handyman would be. He followed up the day before and day of (before the appointment).

Upon arrival he was prepared and friendly. He assessed the parts/chair and confidently installed everything exactly as needed and at a timely manner -- I commend him for agreeing to fix it, especially since he had never worked on a pedi chair (who even has?) and it's fairly complex considering there are water lines and pipes involved. He communicated everything very well.

Thank you for everything. We will definitely be recommending you all to everyone we can!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! It means so much!

name: Rebecca Barganier
text: Excellent experience. 10/10, would recommend, will use again!

resp.text: You are too kind! Thank you!

name: FrostByte
text: Did a great job hanging my tv. Was on time, professionally mannered and dressed.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: Marilyn Ireland
text: Micah did a FANTASTIC job on my 80+ year old antique dining room tabletop.  It had been ruined years ago by a felt backed tablecloth that was ironed on while sewing.  We finally got it refinished and he did a remarkable job.  Thanks so much Birmingham Fast Repair, I will be using you again.  And by the way, the PRICE was awesome!

name: Daniel Noll
text:
Let me tell you a story about these guys. This story takes place in the relatively small parking lot of the hotel I am staying in.

Before we get started though, know that I tried to resolve this issue directly with the company. The responses I received from them began with a man named "Andrew" responding to my initial email with "who the heck is this".

In the attached pictures you will see what their workers did. Things the company clearly considers acceptable, because their attitude towards the situation was condescending at best.

Thing #1: You'll see 3 trailers here. One is a different company, one is Scott's Services (the middle one) and one is unmarked. It's not easy to see how many spots they are taking up, but at least 6.

The drivers were there, and were aware of the problems they were causing. People were actively driving around the lot trying to find parking spots. You can also see the company name on the truck here.

There is another truck here that is apparently also theirs. After the front desk agent of the hotel asked them to stop blocking parking spaces, they refused, claiming they were stuck. After the agent left they had a good laugh about it, and then moved into the unmarked truck.

Thing #2: This is the other side of the parking lot. Another of their vehicles. A much smaller vehicle. One capable of fitting into a single space, and yet they managed to take up two with this one as well. Surely this truck was not stuck as well. What stopped them from fixing this one and freeing up a space?

Upon reporting this behavior to the company, I was told by the person named Andrew that I had a personal problem, and that the hotel should deal with the issue if they feel they need to. I should also stop trying to get hard working people in trouble just because I cannot park where I want. Because everyone knows only Scott's Services' workers are hard working - none of the other patrons of the hotel they inconvenienced were hard working people as well.

In the adult world we do not get "in trouble"; We get held accountable for our actions. The company's refusal to hold their employees accountable for their behavior is a clear declaration that the behavior is condoned by the company, and that these actions accurately reflect the values of Scott's Services.

Consider these things when you consider working with them. This is how they might choose to behave.

text:
We had one light that flickered and popped.  There were three other switches within that box.  I called two other places, one strictly did commercial, the other called me back 8 hours after I left my message at their time of opening and informed me that they could have someone out in the next month or so... flicker... pop.

Lenny informed me that his schedule was booked but he will come in the afternoon.  Inspection of the light switch proved that it was installed at the cheapest possible way, and the wiring was not even grounded.  Possible fire hazard... flicker... pop.

A one light switch fix became an entire rewire on the housing kit with grounding, and he also fixed a light source within my garage.

We are grateful for Lenny taking my call and understanding the severity of what would happen if he did not come here accordingly.

I will always recommend Lenny.  He did an awesome job.  As far as the other companies, now i understand why there's a limited amount of reviews.

name: Robert Ball Jr
text:
Successful Residential Service Upgrade!
This was my second time to engage the services of Bass Electrical and I was impressed once again. Bass Electrical Contracting provided 1 of the 3 bids I obtained for performing a residential service upgrade. I wanted to replace the 60-amp fused panel with a 200-amp service and breaker panels. Bass wasn't quite the lowest bid but got the work because of the previous experience I had.
Sam worked with me through several revisions of quotation as I tweaked a request or two. I appreciated Sam's attention to getting the scope clearly identified before any work began. Bass coordinated with Alabama Power for dropping and re-connection of the service, as well as with Auburn's Code Enforcement department for permitting and inspection.
Josh, Levi, Aaron, and Travis arrived on time and we talked through the job. They seemed to have a good understanding of the scope. The two teams worked smoothly and efficiently to get the job done. They were courteous, friendly, and quick to answer any questions I had along the way. They also had a few questions for me and I appreciated them allowing my input. They started about 8 AM and finished just after 3 PM. Power was on and the difficult part of the upgrade completed successfully.
They returned to my home the following week to label all of the breakers. I appreciated the attention to detail there, as well. Bass Electrical Contracting made me a satisfied customer.

name: HawkPilotUSA
text: After years of performing my own spark plug, oil change, filter change and basic upkeep and documenting each service...I called Current Electrical to schedule a service and firmware upgrade. I do not have the capability or knowledge to update the unit and couple that with another spine issue preventing me from the physical aspect of the task- it was the logical choice to call the folks that sold me the unit.   I was told that if more than a year passed without them performing a service that I would pay an additional $198 on top of the $289 service.  After receiving over $5000 from my family for a 22kw Generac generator installation they have the nerve to charge what I see as a penalty of $198 because I didn’t use their services every year.  A basic service for me costs approximately $50-$60 to purchase the Generac OEM kit.  My labor is free.  When asked about their policy a lady who spoke with me stated it’s their policy.  Then went the route of telling me a hypothetical situation like “...if a technician comes out...whatever he touches ... he’s responsible for...that’s why we charge the fee.”  So I asked, “...so if he comes out and everything is ok and it just needs a service do you skip the $198 charge?”  She said”no.” I thanked her and found another Generac dealer company that has already provided me with a service date.  Be aware of your future responsibilities to this company that installs your generator.

resp.text: Hi! Thank you for leaving a review. As we stated to you and is our policy that is listed in our documents and verbalized, we service and maintain what we sell and once that service is declined we do charge a rate to come back out on top of our service rate. We would love to speak more about this with you.

name: Robert Carrell
text:
I received quotes from three providers and ultimately chose CURRENT ELECTRIC SERVICE, LACEY'S SPRING, ALABAMA for install my standby generator.  They arrived, placed a pad and installed the generator.  The guy who seemed to be in charge said that they had checked the generator and it was good to go.  My wife and I discovered that the green light, indicating that the generator was functional, was not on.  A red light was on.  This was at 11:30pm at night.  It wasn't running or doing anything weird, so I called the Generac corp. office and a man there told me how to turn the generator off.  I did such and the next day, I called CES to inform them of the problem.  I had to tell my story to three different people.  THEN they said that the owner would have to talk to me to get an 'OK' for a service call.(?)  So, I called him and he proceeded to criticize how I had handled the situation.  I didn't want to call someone out in the middle of the night for, what appeared to be a non emergency problem.  He finally okayed a tech to come out.  The tech could not find anything wrong after a 'thorough and complete' exam.
About 10 days later, my wife and I were out in the yard and we heard a very loud clang sound.  Repeatedly , a harsh noise seemed to be coming from the transfer switch that goes  to the generator.   We called CES and had to tell our story to three people again and, as it was 4:30pm, we finally were referred to "Buddie", who said that everyone had gone home for the day.  This was their response to what sounded like a very damaging situation occurring.  I demanded to talk to the owner.  He called again and criticized me again for how I had handled the situation.  He also was abusive about how I had spoken to his employees.  The best defense is, apparently, still a good offense.  So, I went on defense reflexively.  I just wanted the machine to be fixed.  He said that it was the Huntsville Utilities problem.  He said, reluctantly, that he would call back a tech who lived in Guntersville to make a service call.  I called HU and they had no complaints of outages.  I also checked with both neighbors, who had no problem.  At this  point, the HU tech came out and he said that everything on the electrical service was in good working order.  The technician from CES arrived and examined the generator. He said that he had never seen anything like this problem before.  GREAT!!   So, he increased the idle time between my service going out and the generator startup. His parting words were that he would call Generac and find out what the problem was and would call me.  RIGHT!!   At this juncture I had had enough of CES and I transferred my warranty to Mr. Electric.  Days later the same scenario occurred with harsh clashing sounds coming from the transfer switch.   I called Mr. Electric and one person handled the problem and sent out a service tech.  He discovered that two color-coded wires had been installed to the wrong color-coded positions, rendering the machine sensing low wattage coming into my house from HU.  He took pictures of the situation and re installed the correct color wire to the correct color position and the problem was solved.  He asked if the CES techs had performed a post installation check on the generator, because this incorrect wiring pattern would have been discovered if CES had done a post installation check.  I told him that the CES guy told me that they had done the check up.  EVIDENTLY NOT!!!  He showed me the reading on the machine with the crossed wires was stimulating the generator to turn on.  The wattage read on the LED was low.  He fixed this problem and looked the entire installation over.  I have to give at least one star to CES in order to get this posted, so  one star to CES for having a pulse.  Five stars to Mr. Electric.

name: Nancy Owen
text: All I can say is Autumn Air was professional, trustworthy, economical and exceeded all my expectations. There is nothing more aggravating than to have your air conditioning unit quit. Although it is mid-October we needed our air conditioning fixed ASAP. Our unit was 17 years old and I knew we needed to replace it if not immediately, within the very near future. I emailed a few companies Saturday night asking for estimates and to please contact me Monday morning. Only Autumn Air and one other company returned my call today. Autumn Air was very pleasant and offered to have someone come out to price the unit immediately. Since I knew I did not want to start throwing money away repairing such an old unit I asked for a quote for a new unit (with and without the furnace). Skip came out and priced the unit with three options and it was clear if I wanted more options he would give them to me. He did not acted putout or frustrated with my request. He did not pressure me to make a decision nor did he push me to buy the most expensive product. Without me asking, he let me know the specials that were being offered. I asked how soon they could install the unit and he said either this afternoon or in the morning. I called my husband and sent him the estimates. My husband was impressed and even showed his fellow employees who were also impressed with the prices. After weighing the pros and cons we decided to replace the entire unit (with furnace). I called Skip back about 2:30 saying we did want to go ahead and replace the unit, he said he would call me right back, that it would be either this afternoon or in the morning. I was floored when he called me back shortly afterwards and asked if it was okay with me if they could install it today. Skip and two other gentlemen came and installed the unit working hard until close to 9:00 pm. We were all extremely grateful to the diligence of these men. In addition, Autumn Air included a 2-year service plan where they will come out to service/clean the unit twice a year. They have earned my trust. I am very thankful to Autumn Air.

resp.text: Thank you!!!!

text: Well this guy trys telling us that we needed a WHOLE new unit when in actuality we need 1 part and to find where the freon is leaking. He says it's holding freon when I know for a FACT it's empty. He did not go into the crawl space of where part of the unit is located. This guy is trying to sell us something we don't need. Reason being,  our 18 yr.old son was the one home who doesn't know any better than to just let him in. Didn't talk to my wife or me about anything. Very unsatisfied with this company. We have 5 properties and while our normal ac guy was servicing our rentals(while we waited days for the first company you sent) looked at it and told us exactly what was wrong.... NOTHING MORE THAN REGULAR WEAR AND TEAR.

Then Hannah in customer service asked me to stop yelling at her while I was having a conversation , with phone on speaker, haven’t disrespected her nothing and she stops me to tell me stop yelling. Instead of trying to understand the message I’m trying to get her to understand , she is asking me to lower my tune when it wasn’t in a disrespectful manner and I told her that several times. name: John Hosmer
text:
For a long while there have been atmosphere issues in our basement where the previous home owners had never taken care of sealing up the rooms and keeping temps and humidity in check. We had addressed those issues and we had tried using good filters at the returns to prevent as much of any dust, mold spores, etc. from recirculating and spreading, but it ended up being a losing battle for both comfort and our family's health.  Finally, about a month ago I disconnected one of the flexpipes at the end of the trunk run to see just how bad it was and found almost 100% coverage of dust, mold, and nastiness throughout the system. It was in every bit of the trunk, and every flexpipe throughout the house (See pictures). Even a few of the vent registers had started harboring mold growth which was a really bad sign as well.

So, I did what any good panicking homeowner would do at that point. Went to Google, pulled up nearby HVAC companies with good reviews that could do duct replacement, and called for appointments for onsite inspections. Out of the four highly reviewed and reputable companies (minus individual contractors) in the Pelham area that actually showed up for their appointment, Autumn Air's rep Baker was the only one who showed up on time, actually visually inspected inside the ductwork even after I showed him the initial pictures I took, and then spent a solid amount of time explaining to me options for replacing the entire ductwork system so we could see about what would be right for our budget. In the end, the price that Autumn Air was able to provide for an upgrade to a new round smooth metal interior and outside insulated wrapped system, including new boots and registers, throughout the entire house, plus a new central AprilAire Space Guard filtration and iWave-R GPS ionization system upgrade (per my request) beat out the one other company who actually sent me a quote by almost half. Let me say that again differently...TWO of the four companies NEVER sent back a quote. This told me that two of the highly reputable companies in the Pelham area that have a high amount of favorable reviews simply did not want a job. Pitiful for them.

Fast forward to the install a week later...Led by two guys named Javy and Charles, they took care of making sure everything was treated with care when taking out the old ductwork so as to minimize spreading of dirt and mold as much as could be. Then, they proceeded to assemble and install all of the new system on site for custom fitting plus making sure all seams were taped properly and coated with mastic so that the chances of air leaks past the coils is forever kept at a minimum. They arrived early in the morning, and worked until the job was finished that evening (on the day of Harvey storms coming through too!).  Any questions I had concerning anything with the job was answered and explained with no hesitation on their part.  They went beyond expectations with accommodations and I just can't be any happier.

I can't say it enough in this entire description here how great Autumn Air is for an HVAC company. They want someone's business in the best way because they give the work the best service they can at reasonable prices, and offer great financing options too if needed. They understand how to go the extra mile to make sure the customer is being taken care of in the end as well. I can say I have also had the pleasure of meeting Jeff, the owner, later when he came back to look at a minor issue that crept up post install, and he is just as awesome about discussing more than the "here's what we'll do". He takes the time to explain the why and how's (if you are interested to know and ask) and will work with you as a customer to do everything he can within reason to make sure you are satisfied with him and his company. Because of all of these things described about everyone at that company and how we were treated, we now not only have clean, sanitized fresh air, but the confidence to know it will stay that way due to the complete service and professionalism we got from Autumn Air.

Description of work:
Heat Pump and Air Handler Replacement - increased from 4ton unit to 5ton unit - duct work modifications to accommodate increase. Original construction of our home, 12 years ago, was  rushed and the a/c and duct work was thrown together quickly and in a sloppy manner. Our duct work was constricting air flow and in need of modifications. Our power bill was astronomical. So we called Autumn Air.

name: Max Levi
text:
Autumn Air (Charles in particular), have been absolutely incredible!  My existing furnace kept cutting off in the mornings, but then it ran fine for most of the day.  It was a difficult thing to track down, and they never quit troubleshooting to get to the root of the issue so they could fix it the right way.

This took several trips, they tried several things, one at a time, to narrow it down.  Instead of changing a bunch of things or applying "band-aids", they worked hard to pinpoint the true issue.  It ended up being a piece of metal (limit) that was popping and shutting it off prematurely (before the heat limit actually occurred).  So a tiny faulty limit had to be found, and they found it.

It took a lot of patience and tedious work at times.  They just had the attitude of "I'll find the root cause no matter what it takes, and I won't stop until I find and fix it."  I truly believe others would have given up or chalked it up to an issue with my new thermostat.

I really appreciate the time and effort that was put into troubleshooting, not giving up, and finding the real issue, and fixing it the right way!

name: Deidre Stone
text: We built our house just 3 Summers ago. During that 3 years it seems like either 1 unit or the other was in a struggle and the builder's installer was at my house at least every 6 months. It just never did heat or cool correctly and ran what seemed like constantly. You can imagine my frustration in a new home. This spring we called Autumn Air. They came right out and checked everything. They even went into the attic and found an issue with a clogged drain. (which the other guys never did) The air has been so cold all Summer that we can't set it under 74 without getting a chill and my power bill is HALF of what it has been in the past! Here we are 4 months later and my technician, Baker, gives me a courtesy call to just see how things are going since the service. I can't say enough good about these guys! Affordable, professional, and quick! I won t call or recommend  anyone but Autumn Air going forward!!Thanks for taking the stress out of my Summer!

name: Woody Armstrong
text: I have been with a different local HVAC company for the past 4 years. I had been content with them and their service until I had a repair. I had a capacitor go out and I was charged over $300 to replace it. I didn't think much about it until I shared my story with a few people who know what they are talking about. Turns out it was a steep price! I lost TRUST and confidence with them for work. I heard Autumn advertising on WDJC and thought I would check them out. Their monthly maintenance program is very reasonably priced and I even quizzed them on how much a capacitor replacement would run...much more reasonable! So I made the switch and scheduled my first maintenance visit...next day I might add and not in 6 weeks like the other. I was once again shocked at how bad my other service companies quality of work was for maintenance as Charlie showed me all of the stuff that wasn't being done! So, I am very happy I made the switch and hopeful that I have a company I can trust!

name: Lee McCarty
text: Our air conditioner decided to break down late Friday night, so I found myself in the position of trying to find someone to come out on Saturday to fix it. After calling numerous other companies that were in my area, each time just being told they had no available service time except later in the week, (none of them even asked exactly what the unit was doing, or what was wrong). I found Autumn Air online, and even though they weren't in my area, I figured I had nothing to lose trying them. My call was answered professionally, and he took my info and told me that they were pretty full for the day, but that they would try to fit me in. He asked me for details on what was wrong. After about 10 minutes, he called me back saying that they had a cancellation and a tech could be. at the house in about an hour. An hour later the tech was here and within 30 minutes we had cool air!!! I want to thank Autumn Air for taking the time to talk to me and for fitting me into their busy schedule on such a hot Saturday. The price was VERY reasonable, especially considering that it was a Saturday in the busy Summer season. I would recommend this company to everyone I know!

resp.text: Lee thanks so much for the recommendation.  Please let us know if we can help you in the future.

text: The technician was polite and competent enough for the job. He replaced a leaking outdoor faucet. The COST WAS EXCESSIVE. This company uses a notebook with a printed price list. You pay the service fee in addition to  the listed price. . The cost has nothing to do with time spent, parts used, or ease of access to the job.  The technician spent less than 20 minutes and the cost was $577.  He left the old faucet laying on the ground. I regret that I agreed to the job.

resp.text: Hi Cindy, thank you for your honest feedback. Input like yours helps us take steps towards improving as a company. We are sorry to hear the cost of our services didn't meet your expectations. We provide upfront pricing before the job begins so there are never any surprises. We also pride ourselves on cleanliness and picking up after each job - so we sincerely apologize for the faucet that was left behind. Please know we will be addressing each of your concerns with the management team, but we'd also love the chance to speak with you directly. Please call us at your earliest convenience: 205-942-1405

name: Fred Patterson
text: OnTime Service is a great electrical contracting company.   Most of my experiences with contractors on the Eastern Shore have been pretty mediocre at best.   OnTime Service was a refreshing change.   They are a well established Birmingham based company that just recently branched out to Baldwin County.   They took my call immediately (unlike the other 3 electricians that never called back) and the next day an electrician showed up to install the transfer switch for my house generator.   It was pretty clear the technician was very skilled and was very pleasant to work with.   They have a preset price book, which matched what I was expecting for cost.   If you need a competent electrician that cares about customer service, give these folks a call.

He replaced thermostat with the proper one, so I can use ‘auto’ function. Everything seems to be OK. Good Job Kevin!

11/5 Derrick returned and we decided after an evaluation of the problem, my unit (heat side) can not be run in the ‘Auto’ mode. He removed the new thermo and put my old one back in not using ‘Auto’. name: Gary Jones
text: I scheduled appointment to quote 7 separate electrical improvements in my house. They contacted me the day of appointment to ask to reschedule. We rescheduled for two weeks out. After calling in late to work to be present for an 8:00 appointment, I waited until 9:30. No show. I called the home office number. They explained that there was a circumstance that made them late; didn't know when they would arrive. I cancelled the appointment and will use another company that showed up the first time, on time. I gave two stars because Mr. Electric was recommended. Can't be all bad. But, really need to work on communication.

resp.text: Gary, we do value your time and regret that this was your experience. Customer service is always a top priority at Mr. Electric, and while we have fallen short in this instance, we do appreciate your feedback and will make adjustments on our end so that we are able to better serve our customers going forward. Thank you.

name: Rosie Smoots
text: I’m SO pleased with their service!!! I wanted to install a ceiling fan on my covered porch. I contacted my regular electrician and after waiting a week and a half, I was told it can’t be done. I then contacted a second electrician and was told it can be done but the wires won’t be hidden and it will be “very unsightly”.  I decided to try Mr. Electric because the quote was free and timely. David Hurley came out within an hour of me calling and gave me a fair estimate. Less than 48 hours later I’m now enjoying my new ceiling fan (with no exposed wires) on my covered porch!!!! The job was quick, he explained my warranties AND he cleaned up after himself which I was not expecting! I’d recommend Mr. Electric for any of your electrical needs. 5-stars

resp.text: That is great to hear, Rosie! We appreciate your comments and are glad to hear you are enjoying your porch even more with your new fan. Thank you for your business, and let us know if there is anything else we can do for you!

name: James Ocallaghan
text: Electrician was on time (Mitch Davis) completely inspected all electrical systems in my home. Updated all switches, etc. to code. Updated the outside panel box. Technician was very knowledgeable and did not stop until all was completed. I have dealt with other electrical people in the past but I find this Company to be very fair and efficient. A job well done. Without hesitation, I would recommend Mr.Electric to everyone who has electrical work in their home.

resp.text: We appreciate your comments, James. Thank you for choosing Mr. Electric!

name: Chlora Evans
text: The Serviceman was VERY helpful. He explained what and why I needed to have done in order for electrical service to be restored after a recent storm. The charges were reasonable and affordable and the work was started the same day. THANKS to all the people who were involved in restoring my power and faith in service people. You make doing business with your company a pleaser. Keep up the GREERAT work.

resp.text: Chlora, those are kind words, and we appreciate your feedback. We are glad we were able to get your power restored after the storm. Thank you for choosing Mr. Electric!

name: Jessica Joyner
text: First off I was looking on Home Adviser for an electrician. I hadn't even fully completed my search and I was receiving a call from Mr. Electric to see what I needed done and when I wanted them to come out and get a free estimate. Yes! I said, "free estimate." That same day, an electrician was sent out and gave me quotes on all my projects. Electrician did not pressure me to do any projects that day and I was able to take 3 weeks and save up the money that I needed to get the project done. The day the electrician came out, he went above and beyond! I will use this company again and again!!!!!!!!! Thank you!

Dan Black
Owner
Mr Electric of Montgomery

name: TheJeffrey575
text:
After scheduling a job I was notified the day before the scheduled electrical work to remind me the electrician was coming and the time within 30 minutes. The electrician showed up right on time ready to estimate the job. After we agreed on the costs the electrician was ready to get started right then! We were used to a contractor estimating a job and notifying us, sometimes a few days later, when they could start work. Not the case with Mr. Electric! The electrician was ready to start.

As the job progressed we needed to make a few changes, so the electrician re-estimated the cost and we were ready to go. The electrician asked me about fire alarms and CO sensors. Our fire detectors were almost 35 years old so we added them to the job.

All the commercial stuff is good, but the electrician was outstanding! They were very responsive to our comments. I have worked thousands of contractors in my work life and now in my retirement. The skill and quality of the electrician's work was simply beautiful. I will definitely call Mr. Electric for my next work.

My only concern was the local franchise was sold to another company so the calls to and from Mr. Electric are not local so I had to be "expecting" a call to keep from looking at the strange numbers and not consider them as robocalls.

resp.text: Wow! With all of your experience, that is quite an endorsement. Thank you so much! Customer service is a top priority here at Mr. Electric and we are so glad to hear that we exceeded your expectations. We appreciate your business.

name: Doug Irvin
text: I had a dimmer switch go bad and was "buzzing" inside. I went to Home Depot and purchased a new three-way switch but upon pulling the old switch out of the wall I found an unusual wiring that I had never seen. The old switch had three wires vs. the new 4-wire switch and the old switch had the green ground wire connected to a "Red" wire. Not wanting to take a chance of burning down my house I took the advise of my friend and called Mr. Electric. They were at my house and had the new switch in within three hours. Although people might feel their price was high, you get dedicated/trained electricians, insured and bonded. I'm willing to pay for that.

resp.text:
Mr Irvin
Thank you so much for the wonderful comments and for choosing Mr Electric.
It's such a privledge to work with customers such as yourself!
Dan Black
Mr Electric of Montgomery.

name: Jason Krueger
text: Excellent, Steve did an outstanding job under less than ideal circumstances.

name: Sleep Walker
text:
Mr. Electric provided 5 star, first-rate service for the replacement of my distribution box and installed (4) additional outlets around the exterior of my house. The workmanship of Steven Leavins was simply marvelous and very professional done. I selected Mr. Electric over Dixie Electric, McGehee Electric and R&H Electric for the following reasons:
•	The survey technician, Steven Leavins, was friendly and conducted a fairly thorough survey of the work to be done. This is important because it prevents rework and unnecessary delays in completing the work.
•	Their estimate was very detail, well structured, and nicely presented. Usually, how the presentation (in this case documentation) is delivered reflects the quality of workmanship you can expect.
•	Quick response/reply. Mr. Electric responded to my initial query within hours as was your estimate. The other companies took 1-2 days to provide an estimate. This is impressive given the nice job done on the estimate.

I was not disappointed in my choice. Steven Leavins was awesome! His work, attitude, and self-pride are worthy of acknowledgement. I'm not easy to please, but Mr. Electric and the team (namely Steven) delivered as promised and as I expected. Really, if you want some electric work done call Mr. Electric first. Oh, yeah, the company is very reasonable. I promise you will love the workmanship (and the people).

resp.text:
Mr F, (Sleep Walker)

You made our day with this glowing review! We can't begin to thank you enough for giving us the privilege
of providing electrical services at your home. We know customers have many companies to choose from and we don't take customers like you for granted! Our whole team works very hard each day to earn each customer's business and that's why customer service and appreciation is so much a part of our company here at Mr Electric of Montgomery. We are very fortunate to have Steven on our team because of his level of professionalism and dedication to quality work.
From all of us here at Mr Electric of Montgomery, thank you for your trust and confidence.

Warm regards,

Dan Black
Owner
Mr Electric of Montgomery
